website_summaries.verdict: A robust UPS that conditions power well and keeps electronics powered during an outage long enough to safely shut them down.
pros: 12 outlets populate this mini-tower UPS, with 6 benefiting from battery backup – enough to protect almost all home office electronics
Includes automatic voltage regulation, helping extend the life of the battery
Software available to monitor and control the UPS
Battery life is impressive, powering longer than rated at half-load
cons: Ethernet ports are somewhat loose and can sink too far into the UPS body to use effectively

customer_reviews.title: Connected Device Policy is meaningless
customer_reviews.text: This UPS was connected to my 70" TV and Roku3. After a lightning storm, neither device worked. I filed a claim with CyberPower under their "Connected Device Policy." The entire ordeal took about 2 months of emails and information. In the meantime I had the TV repaired by a professional who noted the power supply was blown. End result was that my claim was denied on CyberPower's review of the unit. I don't know of any other reason that 2 electrical devices have blown power supplies, but buyer beware- the connected device policy will not protect you.
customer_reviews.author: dom085

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product April 2016. Until now I had no reason to use the "no battery" side of the UPS. When I attempted to plug into that side a spark (more like a flame) that was about 1 inch in size shot out. This does not happen on the "battery" side. I do not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: caught on fire, after 4 days of use. would not buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I shut off my computer and 4 monitors and was getting ready to leave my office. I turned around like i always do to double check to make sure everything is off, but this time I smelled burning plastic looked under my desk and the Battery backup caught on fire. smoke was rolling out of it and I can see the fire inside. I unplugged everything and took it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Dhurel

customer_reviews.title: Two units received, and those two units were inoperative due to E21 error at first power-on.
customer_reviews.text: While I like the user interface on this unit - which is why I thought I'd try it versus my previous brand - it seems like receiving two inoperative units in a row is enough experimentation. Both units displayed an E21 error code a few seconds into first power-on, preceded by a day connected to wall power. To troubleshoot, I checked the battery charge level (~13.25V) and checked to see if each unit would work despite the error code, but they would not. As I don't see that I did anything incorrectly, it appears the manufacturer has a problem in their logic board.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer Fudd

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with a generator!
customer_reviews.text: This product does work as a battery back up and has a reasonable backup time. However, it is not compatible with most generators' power. If you live where power outages last more than an hour, this unit will go dead before your power is restored EVEN if you are on a generator! All of my other electronics work fine directly of the generator except this UPS. It will stay on battery until it runs the battery dead. So, I have to plug in my devices to the wall plug that is powered by my generator. Quite a flaw in design!!!!
customer_reviews.author: cyberdude

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a 18 months - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: An unreliable piece of crap. Bought 18 months ago. Had a first power failure of the unit several months ago, while nothing else was affected. Thought that was fluke. Now 2 months ago came to see the server down and the display on the unit dead with the UPS part of the outlets not working. Diagnostics don't say anything useful. Display is completely dead. Only the surge outlets now work but quite unreliably as the server now suffers power failures once every two weeks without anything else being affected. Had fewer power failures without the UPS during the previous 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: A S

customer_reviews.title: Six years old and still running like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this UPS in 2009, over six years ago. I use it to protect/power my entertainment system and modem/router. It has never once missed a beat. I test it a couple times a year to ensure that it can still hold a charge, and there has been no appreciable drop in overall capacity. There's a reason they've been selling this same model since 2003 - it works like a champ. I'm considering buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Front Panel Display Dead in a Year!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these units and in about a year the front panel displays are dead in all three. On two of the three the power button doesn't even light up when on, on the other one the power button is the only thing that lights up. I'm going back to APC I have one of their units that is 5+ years old and still running strong. You get what you pay for, don't waste your money on CyberPower.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Crow

customer_reviews.title: Lost a IP camera and TV due to faulty UPS!
customer_reviews.text: well i should have heeded the warnings of other reviews and not bought this......today i got a brown out and everything on it shutdown, i went to check it out and it was powered off, i powered it back on and it smelled like burned electrical. My ip camera and TV now dont power up . Thanks alot cyber power. Update: cyber power (claims dept) says even if the unit is faulty they will not replace my attached equipment! Me: really??? Like why state you have a connected warranty and hVe me fill out “loss” claim paperwork if your company doesn’t stand by their warranty! Do not buy from this company!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as a UPS. Worse in fact than a standard surge suppressor, since when the power sags, it shuts off AND DOESN'T COME BACK ON. Edit: Just noticed that the warranty on this is three years, and we are right within the deadline (Purchased August 2017, and today is July 25, 2020). Even though I've already replaced this with an APC unit, I'll go through the warranty process and report back on how good the service is.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: It works, but the fit and finish is nowhere near APC
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and the APC 1500va pure sine unit. The fit and finish of this unit was acceptable, but was a few steps behind the APC unit reviewed at the same time. The buttons were difficult to press and did not work reliably. The button to mute sound was iffy, which is not something you want going off in an office environment. Testing power output revealed acceptable performance and no issues charging or discharging for the rated spec. If I had to choose, I'd spend a few more dollars on the APC unit comparable to this one. I caught it during a price drop and it was comparable in price, but seemed higher quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a 1 star rating on these. Was really disappointed when I had 2 fail less then a year after purchase. I replaced the batteries on these and they still didn't work. Found out the 4 new batteries I bought were also crap (probably been sitting on the shelf for years). I put in some lithium equivalents and everything is good now. The only thing I don't like is that they wire the batteries in series reducing the potential run time. I understand it would require thicker gauge wire, thicker traces and more substantial components. but I'd be happy to pay an extra 50 bucks for it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Megan

customer_reviews.title: Device will fail catestrophically and may catch on fire
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a huge Cyberpower fan. I have bought no less than three of these UPS devices. Two of them suddenly failed without any warning, killing the power to all connected devices. One lasted under six months. The replacement one lasted a little over a year. The third one I ordered for a friend and it literally caught on fire. DO NOT PURCHASE THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Trenton

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. They all seem to die around the same time & leave devices prone to destruction in power outages.
customer_reviews.text: Have two CyberPower UPS devices, both stopped working within a few days of each other. The other unit I bought was a CP1500PFCLCD. This one started with internal relays clacking and wouldn't let the devices connected to it power on. The other one started randomly turning off, and the battery inside of it stopped holding any sort of charge. Today we had a brief power outage, and when it came back on a few seconds later my downstairs PC's SSD is dead and the PC won't boot. The whole point of me buying these things is to avoid exactly this scenario. Not even remotely happy with this garbage. I will never buy another UPS from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: Not working.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited buing this UPS reading the customer reviews. But after receiving and switching the UPS on, it doesn't switch to utilty power and sounds 8 beeps. When reinserting power plug while running, the unit starts beeping 2 beeps every 30 seconds, stating there's no power on outlet. However voltmeter show 128 Volts on power condition. Tried different outlets in the house with same results. Very disappointing! Cannot ship back from Caribbean: too heavy, costs more than unit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Verkerk

customer_reviews.title: Has already been extremely helpful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this UPS to power a music studio I have at my home. The area where I live has extremely unstable power due to overhead lines and lots of construction taking place around me. The power has already gone off several times this month. This device keeps my computers, modems, routers, hard drives, etc., going for a good 20 - 30 minutes with a power failure. Plus, I feel peace of mind knowing my systems are protected from line surges/brownouts. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Patton

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this unit in for 8hrs no load to ensure good charge on the battery, and got a error code. the following is the customer support reply: "Have You charged the unit for at least 8 hours continuously before using it? E02 Error Code indicates "Charger Fault – No Charge". Please send a photo of the unit that displays the error code. For reference, kindly include a copy of the unit's invoice in your response." OBVIOUSLY i can read the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this battery system.
customer_reviews.text: Where I live, there are a fair number of power glitches. Wind, heavy rain storms, etc. I use this battery to run my 65 inch TV, my Direct DVR, the power inserter for the dish, and other small things. This battery will run it all for around 45 minutes when the power goes out. Best, when we have small spikes in the power, none of this equipment ever sees it. It all will keep running for at least 45 minutes no matter what is going on.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Own One
customer_reviews.text: I won't go into the long list of benefits of having a UPS. I'll only say I recommend them to anyone who cares about their electronic devices. My only gripe about the Cyberpower UPSs is that the outlets are not spaced far enough apart. Unless everything you plug into it is a minimalistic three prong plug, several of the outlets are bound to become inaccessible the moment you use a bulky two prong adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Rebootin' Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine Until the Power Goes Out.
customer_reviews.text: This battery "back up" has failed me for the last time, Admiral CyberPower. This works when it wants to, which is not all that often. And I can't tell you how many times the power blips for 1 or 2 seconds and I lose all my work because this UPS decides to stop providing power to my PC even though it still shows 100% battery capacity. Either this thing is incapable of doing self-diagnostics or it just plain doesn't work. Waste of $150. The "illusion" of backup is worse than not having one.
customer_reviews.author: virtuadept

customer_reviews.title: Missing drivers for wifi & mult-monitors to work;  Date & time need resetting repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: Substantial time (as well as having bought additional wifi adapters/dongles) trying to determine why wifi and dual monitors would not work. Computer repair person (whom I've used before) advised me the computer did not have the drivers needed. With the additional time (both in trying to find solutions and in not having the computer available for use) and money, I won't be buying refurbished again. I'd hoped Amazon certification would've been fine, but it was not. Live & learn. Also, each time the computer is turned on, date and time have to be reset. & cannot connect to the Internet until the date and time are reset. Time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: it did not catch on fire like another review said they must have gotten s faulty unit . In Florida between the months of June and August we get numerous thunder and lightning showers during this time my power has been known to flicker in-and-out I've hooked up my 55" TV Wi-Fi router playstation 4 and cable Box I've had to flickers but those things have not going out the surge protection is really good so I do not need to worry about my ps4
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: Network passthru brought my high bandwith connection to its knees
customer_reviews.text: when I routed my 1gig network connection through the rj45 jacks on the back to the unit to protect my desktop from a power surge down the network cable.....I went from instantaneous web access to 1990s dialup style lag time waiting 4-5 sec for pages like google homepage to load. Very nostalgic went back to connect directly and network speed was back. REALLY disappointed because this was one of the main reason for buying the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Pam H.

customer_reviews.title: Good UPS!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, support my desktop and my wife's desktop. The units provide enough juice to keep my computer and dual 24" monitors going during a power blip. My previous UPS (also CyberPower unit) lasted about 2.5 years before the battery was shot and I had to swap it. I ended up buying this model, before I learned I could replace the battery myself (oops). I now have three, happy UPS and I'm pretty happy! By-and-large, I prefer the CyberPower PowerPanel tool and I'm happy to see the power-remaining report in a legacy desktop gadget. I like that all of the UPS models share the same tool and they work well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: KARL LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Weak Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these unit, two worked great and one was DOA. Amazon DOES NOT warranty these, your have to go through the manufacturer. After phone calls and replacement batteries shipped, the unit was still non functional. Called tech support again and they issued an RMA which I printed the slip and shipped back to them and they received it on 8/23/2019. I called yesterday 08/28/2019 to ask where my replacement unit was and they said that they have been busy and will get it out to me in a couple of days. I suggest in the future if you are looking for a battery backup, stick with APC as they cross-ship replacements. This company needs to learn that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul St Jean

customer_reviews.title: This thing destroyed my new PC.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of garbage that does worse than nothing. I paid $150 for this thing and I had my brand new computer plugged into it when a thunderstorm blew in, the devices that I had in the same room that were plugged into cheap power strips were fine but my brand new gaming pc that I wasn't able to unplug in time was completely destroyed, there goes a thousand bucks! I should have just used a $5 power strip. This thing will actively destroy your devices, do not use or buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Adequate battery backup
customer_reviews.text: This backup was necessary for a desktop and computer along with some home studio recording equipment. I like how Windows 10 can monitor the battery charge on the unit with a USB connection. Even with everything plugged into the unit and powered on, the overall load never exceeded half capacity. The power has went out several times and there's always plenty of time to power down the equipment before the battery dies. I also bought one of these for my Resmed CPAP and SoClean units.... so I wouldn't have reset the SoClean clock and clean time every instance of a power "flick" or outage. Overall, it's worth the money and prevents a lot of hassle and aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: BFM90

customer_reviews.title: CyberPower UPS Systems are the Best
customer_reviews.text: We use several small UPS systems to support scattered desktop computers and point to point WiFI systems. Over the years we experienced regular failures of APC systems to the point that I have written APC off my list of vendors. On the other hand, each APC failure has been replaced with a CyberPower system. The CyberPowers have been totally reliable and are today's UPS product of choice.
customer_reviews.author: NativeTexan41

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love it, solved my power issue in my apartment
customer_reviews.text: -built sturdy -lots of great features -display is very helpful -works great Have an issue with the power in my office at home flickering for a brief second almost every single day between 8-8:30. My old battery backup only output 300 watts. Needed something with a higher wattage for my tower. This thing is amazing. I'd highly recommend it anyone. Lots of cool and useful features. The display will show how much power is being pulled from it. Very useful to see your wattage on the computer when it's working under high load. Helps to figure out if you are bottle necking your power supply or something.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Erdman

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: This is running the PC in my office. Keeps the lights on in case of a power failure long enough for me to save things and shut down. Usually the power just flips on and off so this keeps things moving along which is nice during power blips in the summer. Monitoring software is good and easy to use along with readouts of current power consumption numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the WFH Crowd
customer_reviews.text: I've actually got 2 of these. One that is dedicated just to my core networking gear and that will power it EASILY for 8-10 hours of a power outage. The other is for my workstation and one of my 4K monitors, this will power both of those for 30-45 minutes which is just enough time for me to be able to switch to my laptop and or iPad pro to pickup where I left off. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: ascad

customer_reviews.title: Great battery, Excellent customer service and warranty claim
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my CyberPower 1000 for a little over two years. It has worked great through many power outages. Recently I got a red LED light warning that there was a wiring fault. I called CyberPower, they walked me through a battery (no pun intended) of tests to make sure it was the unit itself that was at fault. It turns out that the unit needed replacing and they are sending a new one. Great job backing your 3 year warranty CyberPower!
customer_reviews.author: CJWA 805

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in June 2020. The unit was dead on arrival. Would not turn on, no lights, no display, no sounds. Tried calling the manufacturer's technical support number and they will not even answer the phone. Can't get it repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Collins

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I originally saw the listing for this item, and was skeptical, because it was only $20 more than the previous, less robust unit I bought 13 years ago... and the multiple bad reviews I noticed, were no help. But since it was within budget, I took a chance on it, and now I'm glad I did. It works great, and even communicated with Linux for monitoring, without need for special configurations. If any of the above-mentioned issues are stopping you from getting this unit, ignore them, and just DO IT.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I use this UPS system with my custom-built gaming PC. While $150 seems excessive for what looks like a fancy surge protector, it is absolutely worth the investment to protect a $2500 machine. I no longer have to worry about my PC losing power due to outages (or electrical work, as happened last week) and have plenty of power capacity and outlets for anything at my workstation. This system can even be used to provide more safe and consistent power from "broken" or "weak" outlets or through extension cords (although this type of use is likely advised against by the manufacturer).
customer_reviews.author: Glenn L.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job, but poor outlet / port placement
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. These are for running your system for a few minutes in a power outage, giving you time to shutdown safely. Electrical grid brownouts, for example, won't affect your equipment with these. According to the LED screen, I can get ~ 17minutes of runtime out of my PC, router and network switch which is more than acceptable. My only gripe is that the power outlets on the back are way, way too close together. There are far better layouts than this. Anything that is a "wall wort" type power adapter -- need a short extension or they will take up 2 or three outlets just from their shape.
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT UPS, it is very interruptable
customer_reviews.text: We have very stable power here, but last few months we had thunderstorms 2 times and once we had power loss for other reason. Each single time, this UPS did not offer stable power, so my computer just shutdown instantly creating corrupted files and lost work. Everything is plugged in correctly, load is less than 1/2 of of what is rated maximum. Final verdict... if you could dispose of it in the ocean, it would be a boat anchor... instead it is a disposal headache and now I have to pay someone to take it a recycle it. WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Before buying this make sure you don't need sine wave power
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a decent quality UPS. I made the mistake of not reviewing the specs in detail before buying. It does NOT output pure sinewave AC power. The Dell R720 I bought this for really didn't like the modified sine wave power. The system became unstable and battery run time is much less than expected for the load. I ended up buying a pure sine wave UPS for the server since it really didn't like the power this provides. When I decided to use this for the network switch (Ubiquiti Switch-24) instead, that had no issues. Performance and battery runtime are as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Ranta

customer_reviews.title: Month 4 started getting E21 message
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these and they seemed to always work good but the last one I bought after 4 months started shutting off automatically and stating an e21 error message on the screen. I emailed Cyberpower and had a conversation with someone named Todd. We went back and forth with some troubleshooting things to try. I tried them all and nothing worked. I emailed Todd with CyberPower and asked what next and haven't received a response for the last week.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Arrived NON-WORKING - NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged, nonworking..... “NO RETURNS ALLOWED” I paid for a full product and got nothing. They just shipped it raw, no wonder it’s broken. Should I receive a working item at least.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the task
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if we bought an undersized unit or not. It likes to shut down completely and not restart, even when power is restored. That's a deal breaker, since we're using it on egg incubators and our power is never off long (except when this POS shuts it off and leaves it off).
customer_reviews.author: fourdegreesc

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: 01/20/20 I got this about a week ago on sale for $100. Have not experienced any issues with it yet through one brownout. I currently have my computer (120W idle, 440W during stress tests) and my two 23" 1080p monitors plugged into the battery slots. During daily use, it has the capability to power my set up for 25 minutes and during max usage, about 5 minutes. These times are before the automatic shut off that's set in to preserve power in times of an extended black out. TL;DR For the $100 price I got it for, it's well worth it and I don't have any complaints. 4/23/20 Still amazing and have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Ying

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, pretty easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought to backup my cable modem, router and NAS since recent power outages have inconvenienced me greatly. It replaces a 22 year old APC 1400 Pro backup UPS which finally gave up the ghost. Don't need backup for my laptops, so got this smaller unit. It does the job. With the NAS off, I can run the cable modem and router for about 10 hours (both units draw 35 watts combined). Software is ok with some detailed info, but could be more complete showing graph of power usage per 24 hour period.
customer_reviews.author: GrayslakeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Hope it last more than 2 years this time!
customer_reviews.text: My last unit gave out less than 2 years after first use. It was a 1350VA model of same manufacturer. Didn't realize this or I would have considered another brand. Can't say if this one is any better than the last one, just hope it lasts longer. I usually get 5-7 years from these things, so my last experience was less than satisfactory. I used this unit on my AV equipment (tuner amp, Blue-ray drive, etc.) because they're high end models that are expensive to replace just for crapping power on grid. It's cheaper to replace these units than all the gear it protects.
customer_reviews.author: Gil M. Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Functional & Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've acquired my 2nd one of these... nothing wrong with the first one but it worked out so well on my TV's satellite/DVR box that I got one for my tower PC. Easy to set up, lots of features, and nice reliable monitoring of AC power. We're in a rural area and brownouts are common during storms. Each brownout would cause the satellite/DVR box to reset which takes almost 10 minutes to reboot. The UPS eliminates these annoying reboots by instantly providing power to the connected devices, in our case until the whole-house generator kicks in. Getting one for the tower PC seemed like a no-brainer. The 3-yr warranty is reassuring, too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Finally had to replace an older CyberPower backup
customer_reviews.text: After 8 years my older CyberPower backup stopped working, battery dead, alarm signal etc. With that kind of longevity from the older one I stuck with CyberPower. The new one works great, have already had several short power outages from thunderstorms and it kicks in keeps everything running.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect backup for my router
customer_reviews.text: I got this when our neighborhood was having periodic blackouts and power failures. Just a blip in power would cause me to lose significant time and cause huge frustration waiting for the thing to reboot. A few times it would go down in the process of submitting data which was subsequently lost. While our power supply has stabilized, having this in play has saved me on a number of occasions. It will keep our AT&T router going for 4-6 hours without fail.
customer_reviews.author: Papadoc

customer_reviews.title: I've owned 3 of these - I'm out $450 - TERRIBLE PRODUCT - AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of them fail and the last one shows everything correct and if we have a power flicker everything just shuts down. Yes, I am using them correctly and they last about 6 months before giving a variety of problems. Looking into other options now as my 3rd one has failed and I felt the need to come back and review. I've lost over $450 in these things now, do yourself a favor and keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Fwdmotion

customer_reviews.title: Had problems with the first one but seller responded well when contacted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with the extra warranty. I plugged the product in for 12 hours when I first received it prior to use. I have only my computer and monitor connected to it. We have had very strong winds and I have had 3 power outages in the last 2 weeks. When the power goes out, this power source does not even allow me to turn off the computer. I have since been able to reach Amazon who contacted the seller. They responded rather quickly and the issue appears to have been resolved satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting; does the job
customer_reviews.text: This unit accommodated my entire home theater system, although only half of its components were running at any given time. The battery gave out after 5 1/2 years - Pretty good! But when it died yesterday, everything plugged into the UPS-protected bank of 5 outlets was no longer powered, while the surge-protection-only outlets still operated. Once I figured this out, I had to plug in the affected components elsewhere while I await a replacement battery.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Unit arrived with broken LCD screen
customer_reviews.text: Unit is defective, I was told by amazon that it's no returnable. LCD screen on the front is not displaying anything and its made the unit not a very useful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: OK UPS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these about a half a year ago and they work pretty good. One NOTE: One of the units Power Button LED light went out. It took over 2 weeks for support to send information on returning the device for replacement. The unit still works fine, you just can't tell if it is on except by looking at the devices that are plugged into it and seeing they are powered on. I only need to replace the power button so I am not sending it back for just that. Support could be better and more timely in their responses. I am not sure I would buy again. I've used APC SmartUps in the past with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: DB Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase of this unit. This latest unit came with an E21 error code right out of the box. Amazon won't let you return it, but they will send you a replacement. So if you wanted to buy a different brand rather than reward this manufacturer with your dollars again, no can do. Now I have to figure out where to recycle this thing on my time and dime. Pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: John.K.

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, no issues to report
customer_reviews.text: I know others have had issues but for me this works perfectly. This UPS is for maintaining a yacht's internet and alarm notification at power loss. I have tested it a few times and everything is working as intended. UPS easily keeps, modem, router, power supply convertor, relays, IP dialer going during power loss. Will update in future if anything changes. I believe that others maybe overloaded the ups and had negative results, just a thought.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. S

customer_reviews.title: SPARKS AND OZONE
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this unit has failed. I am awaiting cyberpowers tech to reply. Turned unit off when power failed, after shutting down all items attached. Power back, waited a few minutes to ensure all was steady. Turned on...Sparks, coming all the way through the vent slots, Ozone smell. Did not come on. Unplugged and have contacted cyberpower. Too bad. An earlier version has done well.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger C. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: 1500VA/900W This model Defective, Brown Out will turn it off
customer_reviews.text: CyberPower CP1500AVRLCD Intelligent LCD UPS System, 1500VA/900W, 12 Outlets, AVR, Mini-Tower This model Defective, Brown Out will turn it off. Have 3 of this model & all of them have the same issue. All of them less than 2yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: minister for hire

customer_reviews.title: Died after a couple of years - very limited use
customer_reviews.text: bought this because we kept having brown outs. it worked at first, then stopped keeping my MAC Pro running long enough to shut it down. Slowly took everything off the UPS until I was down to only the computer. Soon, it could not even support that. I bought a whole house backup generator but kept it plugged in as some added surge protection. Finally, it can't even do that anymore. Just a constant alarm that I can't shut off.
customer_reviews.author: billphoto

customer_reviews.title: Not even two years old and it's failing and no support from Cyberpower
customer_reviews.text: I bought this looking for a small unit for my comm closet (Routers, Security Cams etc.) and it's been failing for the past 4 mos. every time there's a power interruption, it just shuts off. Battery is at 100% there are no alarms etc. I've reached out to Cyberpower now 3 times looking for support and I've no response from them. Actually because of this lousy customer support I recommend everybody steer clear of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wood

customer_reviews.title: does not switch to battery power fast
customer_reviews.text: This UPS does not work as advertised, it takes too long to switch to battery power, my computer looses power for a fraction of a second then powers back on, this is suppose to be a UPS ( UNINTERRUPTED POWER SUPPLY), HOW IS THIS PROTECTING MY SYSTEM WHEN IT STILL LOOSES POWER THEN BACK ON ???. Battery power is good when it is on battery, it did properly shutdown my computer when the battery power hit 6 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Terrible And Unreliable Product
customer_reviews.text: This UPS is terrible. I've had the computer off entirely (and the monitor that is on the battery too) and unplugged the UPS to find it counting down the minutes of time left on the back quicker than seconds. It reads around 356 minutes with nothing turned on but counts down each 100 minutes in about 1 minute. Then it beeps 3x indicating a full shutdown. I get a reading of about 50 minutes of time when the computer's running but, when I unplug it, I'm lucky to get 1-3 minutes. This is all when it was brand new, out-of-the-box.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Surge Protection Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Six weeks after ordering this unit, my power blinked and shorted out a computer that was plugged into the surge protection side. After testing all of the components, we determined the motherboard was fried. The surge protection did not work at all. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: DevilsBane99

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working correctly
customer_reviews.text: Had this UPS for 2 years and it suddenly started acting strange. The light on the power button started flickering and going out randomly. Not a huge deal but then the Coax ports caused my internet to go out one day. Couldn't figure out what it was until I plugged the modem directly into the wall and it was working fine. Called tech support and they claimed it was the battery. WHAT!?! Bought a APC UPS instead but plan on getting this one replaced for something non critical.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Short run time, not worth the current price anyway
customer_reviews.text: Its run time is much below the rated time. During a recent outage it ran for 45 mins, supporting a Dell laptop and a 4 port ethernet switch. Compare this to the Cyberpower's sine wave 1500 model, that still had about 72 mins of juice left powering up a slightly larger load of a security camera DVR, a router and a 8 port switch. Too bad this outage happened about a year and half past the purchase date. FWIW, the sine wave UPS is a year older !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The day I received it, I tested it and the unit failed to switch over to battery when power was cut. I contacted tech support and they responded pretty quickly, asking me to send a video showing the testing (self test and unplugging from utility power). After sending the video, I received no response for more than a month a half. At that point, I'd already replaced it with an APC unit and it was no longer worth my time dealing with them. That's the last Cyberpower product that I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Oyesiku

customer_reviews.title: years of service
customer_reviews.text: this one might be bad from the box, it might die tomorrow, we have been using this type and brand for years and they have always lasted for years. Usually the battery will go bad and you can replace them. That is what happened to the smaller one that i am replacing. I will put a new battery in the small one and keep it for a get by it was really not big enough for what i had anyway. For us cyber power is the only back up there is.
customer_reviews.author: H. Turner

customer_reviews.title: E02 ERROR appeared within 30 minutes. Nothing was plugged into the rear!
customer_reviews.text: like other reviewers have reported, there are some defective CyberPower UPS Systems out there and I was the "lucky" winner of one. I plugged the unit into 120V AC and went to lunch before connecting any devices to the control sockets on the back. When I returned, the CyberPower was emitting a loud non-stop tone and the front screen said E02 (see photo). When I contacted Amazon for support, they told me to unplug the devices I had connected and assumed that "load" was causing the problem. However, I didn't have ANY devices connected (zero load). The unit was ruled as a defective. Despite my bad luck, I give Amazon credit for promptly arranging a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Well never really understood the pricing for these battery backups. Why pay $30-40 more for a product that is guaranteed to fail eventually. I guess maybe a warranty thing? If the unit has more features like a network port for remote monitoring that makes sense. Side Note: Last time I did an APC warranty i spent 2 hours on the phone till they admitted it was an issue with the unit. If it doesnt fail out of the box it worked. Just dont overload them or you will kill the battery fast. Just wish they made them smaller. APC whats with the USB A-A cables pretty sure that violates USB standards.
customer_reviews.author: dontcrossme

customer_reviews.title: Spontaneously shuts down
customer_reviews.text: The UPS constantly spontaneously shuts down after a few days up-time. I like to leave my PC on 24x7, and the constant shut-downs defeat the purpose of having an "uninterruptible" power supply. It is extremely annoying. Update 7/3/19: I don't understand why this product is as highly rated as it is. It is complete junk and has consistently failed since I bought it. I'm finally chucking the two of them I bought (one still unused in the box.) in the garbage. I will NEVER purchase another CyberPower product. I can't believe I tolerated it this long. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Ned D Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Power On
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This thing maintains power when the power goes out. It beeps to warn you that it's carrying a load. We've had this one in our living room for a few years now and it has worked great. We just bought another one for our office. It works exactly as we expect.
customer_reviews.author: KellyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use on my networking equipment and cable modem at home due to working from home since Mid-March due to COVID19. Luckily after I got it, we haven't had a power outage or quick blip. Even if this gives we a couple minutes of internet if / when the power goes out, it still allows me to get my hotspot up and running. Will definitely be a life saver when there is a brown out or a quick flicker that is enough to normally reset my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've not had to use Tech Supprt yet so instead of zero stars I'm adding an N/A category here. Overall good UPS so far, my only minor gripe is the orietation of the outlets. The can only accommodate a few of the larger plugs that have integrated converters due to the vertical orientation but I think a majority of the UPSs are like that by nature due to the limited space available. All in all the product has been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says with no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I can't attest to its long term performance yet, but this device was packed well, had all the cables expected, and was very easy to set up. It's very compact, feels well made, and the interface is intuitive. I haven't tested the usb functionality for auto-shutdown yet - if I ever get around to doing so, I will update my review. I currently have my main computer and one monitor plugged into it and on average it reports a 53 minute estimated run time, which is a bit lower than I expected, but I also have a pretty beefy system. Glad I finally bit the bullet and bought this - no more system crashes when the power goes out!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: UPS battery backups work or they do not.  But I recommend that get them on anything of importance.
customer_reviews.text: Being that this is what I do for a living. I design everything with a backup. You do need to make sure that you put one on ALL electronics. If the battery alert goes off to replace the battery do it. But nothing less than 1000va / 600W is what I use and I am familiar with the quality of Cyber Power, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Owen

customer_reviews.title: a few DOA and 1 explosion but overall reliable.
customer_reviews.text: We buy a lot of these units. Maybe 200 of these in the field. Lately we have had some DOA but today's issue was the 1st. Normally i would rate 4-5 stars but today a brand new unit exploded when we plugged it in. We almost got burnt from the massive sparks and smoke filled the room. My guess was the battery was shorted out somehow within the unit. Amazon of course is overnighting a new one but time was already wasted taking to a client, then leaving, just to come back again... Time is money lost.
customer_reviews.author: Danny F

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE - DON'T - JUST DON'T! insufficient voltage on battery
customer_reviews.text: this thing (850va) wont run SQUAT at 92 volts (immediately after power is interrupted or unplugged) - NOTHING is gonna gracefully shut down much less run for even a reasonable amount of time! The built in display LIES (showing 120v ac output on battery) and 2 meters PROVE IT (actual output 92v ac on battery). minimum output to prevent shut down should be at least 103v ac, most equipment wont even run below 100v and this thing cant even maintain 100v...what a POS!
customer_reviews.author: Don R.

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this UPS about 2 months ago and just had a power outage in my unit a few days ago. This UPS worked perfect! It kept my PC's and network equipment running for about 15 min until the power was restored. Every summer we have power outages and i finally decided to purchase a UPS. I am so glad i did as i no longer have to worry about my equipment shutting off unexpected. This was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MarcAnt

customer_reviews.title: Well made, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This relatively small unit is extremely heavy for its size. It appears very well made, from the bank of outlets on the rear, to the comprehensive readout on the front panel. The amount of information provided on the readout is amazing, and will certainly appeal to tech wizards (not me), but also has basic information you need. Hookup is a breeze. Time will tell how it works long term, and it’s protection effectiveness, but my initial impression is very positive.
customer_reviews.author: glind

customer_reviews.title: PC showed up in unusable condition
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in a good box with reasonable packing for a PC, item had loose screws in it that you could hear rattling as you moved it. The PC was missing one PCIe card slot cover also. Machine would not boot disk image was bad. After removing the spare parts re formatting the Hard Drive installed my own version of windows its up and running fine. Maximum Effort needed for what should have been plug in and go...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally unsatisfactory packaging
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered today in a very thin outer box. The inside product box had two large gashes in it. The protective packaging was one thin, very thin piece of packaging paper. I am disappointed in all parts of this deal. At this point it seems to be working, and I hope I don't have to return it. I am glad I purchased the product protection policy because whatever caused the gashes did not damage the outer part of the UPS but the impact may have jarred loose something with the circuitry. I guess time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Monday

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't keep a cable modem running for more than a few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of the 1000avr's for my mother so in case of a power outage her router and wifi would stay up if internet service was running even if the power was out--at least for a hour or two. First test came today with dorian on the edge of west palm, her power went out and the UPS ran for no more than 10 minutes with a cable modem alone attached and then powered off. Keep in mind, this ups is only around 9 months old and has a consistent 1 bar load capacity. Maybe its a decent surge protector but if the UPS performance is any indication I wouldn't bet on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: March 2018 Still working good. still happy with quality and product! A real frustration saver!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area that frequently looses electrical power for split second intervals. Very annoying, since that used to cause the cable box, TV, ROKU box, and Router to lose their settings, and force them to reboot, (long delay, reinstalling pass words, etc. Big inconvenience. So I decided to plug them all into this UPS, and viola, problem solved. Mine powers a large plasma set up for 10 plus minutes of viewing, plus gives me time to shut it down, and then will keep the remote receiver and settings memory powered up for another hour. Usually, even in Florida, the lights are back on by then, and it recharges itself for the next go round.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylord

customer_reviews.title: good backup, bad surge protection
customer_reviews.text: So, purchased this in February. It has worked nicely for the past 4 months. Occasional power outages and this device provided power to the modem and router for almost 6 hours. Better than the display indicated. However, last night we had a lightning strike a tree about 15 meters from house. A few unrelated things were damaged from the surge such as one lighting circuit and an AC blower motor. All other electrical things in the house were fine EXCEPT what was plugged into this device. Everything plugged into this device is toast.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Sefton

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up home electronics and this thing is amazing. Most important things include NAS, smart home hub, mining raspberry pi, modem, router, etc. Plus the various laptops and desktop dock to the filter plugs to prevent surge damage. UPS can power devices for over an hour and communication port can shutdown NAS after a certain amount of time to prevent damage to HDD. Has been a life saver in power outage situations
customer_reviews.author: D.hogan

customer_reviews.title: CyberDud
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Battery depleted within seconds despite tiny power draw. After testing it can barely support a 6 port wired switch for 5 mins. Heavy and now impossible to return. Update: Manufacturer not honoring warranty (<12 months), retailer (Amazon) will not accept return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for a lot of years and it has never failed but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backup supply in October of 2015. It's had two desktop PCs, monitors, and a big old Canon scanner/printer hooked up to it. It's never failed. However, the battery doesn't last very long, either, as in it's going to start driving you nuts with the beeps within just a few minutes. Ultimately it's more than enough to get your system closed down but don't expect to have it last even through a short outage.
customer_reviews.author: Periwinkle

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used all the features yet
customer_reviews.text: I just plugged it up without anything plugged into it to let the battery charge overnight then the next day I plugged my PC and monitors into it. I haven't changed any of the settings as I think the defaults are good enough for my purposes. The powerline behind my house is sensitive to windy rain, so this will save my PC for when the power flickers several times within a few minutes
customer_reviews.author: Khitty

customer_reviews.title: Works just as described
customer_reviews.text: Awesome I got this for my vacation home security system for I don't have to go reboot everything if I loose power and it's awesome I also use them at work and have found that they work well and the battery is easily replaceable by almost any battery shop and at a god price so very very solid product
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great product! You can’t put a price on what potentially can be lost without one of these
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these a year ago for our family room to keep our router and DIRECTV DVR from conking out during a power glitch (nothing is more annoying than a less than one second power failure leads to what seems to be an eternity of rebooting) and it works great. The fact that it keeps your electronics from frying out is even more important! I bought two more 1500’s for my bedroom and son’s room and a 1000 for my daughter when they went on sale for Black Friday. We also use them at work (flight simulation company) to keep the image generator systems from a hard failure. They’re great.
customer_reviews.author: ir0nli0nzi0nzbee

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend. When the battery starts to fail, the UPS will start to fail, even when it is connected to power. Perhaps because of the automatic voltage regulation? Not sure. The display does not indicate battery is weak but I suspect after 3 years, that is the case. Works for a few hours and then turns off disconnecting all power even though line power is present. Replacing all my cyberpower with APC as the cyberpower starts to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product works as intended if you take the time to figure out how it works - which isn't particularly difficult. The software is a bit annoying, especially because you have to get creative to get more than one device connected at a time. I run two desktops and the monitors off this device, as well as a shredder and printer. So far, the device hasn't failed me.
customer_reviews.author: zunami

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this power supply in 2016. By 2017 every time we had a power blink the thing would go off and we would have to manually turn it off. We were using about 25% of its reserve power. So I plugged just a small clock into it to see how it would work. It does not even show that it has a load. Power goes out and so does the UPS. I have APC's which are much smaller and have lasted 10 years. I will never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: It deserves 0 stars. Upon receiving the unit, everything worked. One year later, upon routine check, I realized that the battery doesn't hold the charge at all. Even with no load, the system shuts off in less than 2 minutes. I have had no power outages during the last year, so I can't say that the UPS system has been heavily used. Basically, this system is as good as a surge protector after one year. There is really no point in buying this system since you can't rely on it in the rare event of a power outage. Furthermore, contacting the company for warranty/repair is also not straightforward. Will update the review after warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I owned and used a smaller unit from Cyberpower for years. Was a bit disappointed when the battery failed and found out it was a special order item. I decided to upgrade to this unit. This one for a third more in cost of the special battery, I was able to get 4x the run time during a power failure! I can now power my server for an hour before the software shuts it down. I tested it after charge up, unplugged from the wall and let it just run. Also, the Linux software was surprisingly easy to setup concidering it was command line based. I can see any novice (new to Linux person) working it without issue. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse of a unit.
customer_reviews.text: Very, very quiet. Workhorse of a unit. Not made a sound since I plugged everything in. Power failure warning was functioning very well when the power in the house did go off during a thunderstorm. Plenty of time to save and shut down my computer and periferals. At the time was also digitizing some old footage so had a total of four machines working off it.
customer_reviews.author: Valda Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good UPS, Good price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using CyberPower for years now, used to always do APC, but CyberPower's performance and price won me over. Great that they have put different colored outlets on the back to distinguish battery protected vs just surge protected, and there are 6 outlets of each with 1 of those on each bank separated from the other 5 to allow large AC adapter brick to fit. The LCD display is always nice, showing current status of load, capacity, etc.
customer_reviews.author: James Yee

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, great price, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Most of the UPS Devices I've purchased over the years have been CyberPower so I may be a bit biased but I've never really had an issue with their performance, so I keep adding more units around the house and office. This model had the appropriate number of battery backup outlets and enough surge outlets for the extras that't don't need battery backup.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saeler

customer_reviews.title: 13 months and it died, replacement died 4 months later
customer_reviews.text: 13 months after purchase, the unit seems to have malfunctioned. It makes a constant beep with the Over Load light illuminated on the front panel. I have unplugged everything, unplugged from the wall and still the beep persists. I have written the manufacturer but have not received a response as of yet. I will update this review once I get a response. ***UPDATE*** Replacement UPS died 4 months after receiving. These things are junk. Stay away unless you like buying UPS's every 4-6 months
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Glover

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: I have this unit installed in Mexico, and we have less-than-wonderful electricity from the pole. I've had it more than 5 years, and it works perfect. We have FREQUENT brownouts/blackouts and over-voltage conditions, and this device has never failed. I can keep working for a long while when everything in the house is out. Before I got it, I had to replace two computers because of fried circuit boards - no longer. Everything works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking UPS with good features.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on the desk and works well so far. Once you connect a USB cable from your computer to the UPS and download the power panel software you can then configure it the way you want, but I do get error messages stating that the computer is now running on battery power when it is clearly still on AC. The message only comes on the screen for a second and then disappears so it must be some sort of glitch with the software. Overall this is a good UPS to keep your system running in the event of a power outage for a short time until you can shut down your computer properly.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Brock

customer_reviews.title: Just what you want for your next thunderstorm.
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country and electrical outages are common. While you can't plug the laser printer into it or other high draw electrical devices into it, It protects my computer, monitor beautifully. It gives me plenty of time to close things down and turn things off. The price was right and it protects against large fluctuations as well. Just what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Burson

product_meta.title: CyberPower CP1500AVRLCD Intelligent LCD UPS System, 1500VA/900W, 12 Outlets, AVR, Mini-Tower
product_meta.description: Size:1500VA / 900W| Pattern Name:SingleA mini-tower UPS with line interactive topology, the CyberPower Intelligent LCD CP1500AVRLCD provides battery backup (using simulated sine wave output) and surge protection for desktop computers, workstations, networking devices, and home entertainment systems. The CP1500AVRLCD uses Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR) to correct minor power fluctuations without switching to battery power, which extends battery life. AVR is essential in areas where power fluctuations occur frequently. The CP1500AVRLCD comes with a three-year warranty (including coverage of batteries) Battery Backup Supplies power long enough for equipment to properly shut down when utility power fails. Helps prevent loss of data and minimizes the component stress caused by a hard shutdown. Surge Protection Diverts excess voltage away from sensitive electronic equipment during an AC power surge or power spike to prevent damage. Data Line Protection Prevents power surges that travel through telephone, coaxial, and Ethernet lines from causing damage to electronics. Line Interactive Topology Exists when a line interactive UPS has an auto transformer that regulates low voltages (e.g., brownouts) and over voltages (e.g., spikes) without having to switch to battery. Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR) Provides clean, consistent AC power by automatically regulating low voltages and over voltages, within defined tolerances, when incoming utility power has minor fluctuations. Simulated Sine Wave Output Uses pulse wave modulation to generate a stepped, approximated sine wave to supply cost-effective battery backup power for equipment that does not require sine wave output. GreenPower UPS Bypass design Is a patented design that allows utility power to bypass the UPS transformer, when AC power is stable, which reduces energy consumption, noise, and heat buildup. Multi-function LCD panel displays immediate, detailed information on the UPS battery and power conditions, alerting users to potential problems before they can affect critical equipment and cause downtime. Ultra quiet design minimizes noise during operation for a quieter work environment. PowerPanel personal software provides a user-friendly dashboard interface for controlling and monitoring the UPS. Free software download available here. Energy Star: This model is an Energy Star certified Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) system. Energy Star is the trusted, government-backed symbol for energy-efficient products and practices that help save money and protect the environment. Automatic voltage regulation: Yes – single boost (10%).
